roleset.name: look forward to, anticipate, anticipating (not thing antipated), in expectation
roleset.note: EXPECT-V NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls wish-62 and conjecture-29.5-1. (from expect.01-v)
EXPECTATIVE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SHARP. (from expectative.01-j)

roles.note: If you want to make the rel your Arg1, you're not looking at an eventive usage. (from expectation.01-n)

example.name: nominal arg1
example.text: Portfolio managers expect further declines in interest rates.

example.name: sentential arg1
example.text: The company expects *trace* to obtain regulatory approval.

example.name: passivised
example.text: [Regulatory approval]-1 is expected *-1 soon by everyone

example.name: passivised with extraction, use concatenation
example.text: [The Senate]-1 isn't expected *-1 to act until next week.

example.name: discourse-connective
example.text: As *trace* expected *trace*, John said something stupid again.

example.name: Arg0, 1
example.text: Thus, the subjects in the expect-to-like condition first saw three cartoons that confirmed their expectation that the cartoons would be funny.
example.arg: that the cartoons would be funny
